subject: Philosophy
title: Dharma: Duty and Order
description: Learn Dharma: Duty and Order in one minute.

hook.text: In the Bhagavad Gita, a warrior refuses to fight. Krishna tells him it's his duty.

buildup.text: Dharma means duty, righteousness, and cosmic order. It varies by role, age, and situation.

discovery.text: A teacher's dharma is to educate. A leader's is to protect. Everyone has a role in the larger order.

twist.text: Following your dharma doesn't guarantee comfort. Arjuna's duty was to fight a war he didn't want.

climax.text: Dharma says: do what's right because it's right, not because of the outcome.

punchline.text: Duty doesn't care about your comfort.

quiz.question: What does dharma mean in Hindu philosophy?
